info.title: ChirpStack REST API
info.description: For documentation, please refer to www.chirpstack.io.

parameters.description:
Max number of applications to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If set, the given string will be used to search on name (optional).
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Tenant ID to list the applications for.
parameters.name: tenantId

parameters.description:
Application ID (UUID).
Note: on create this will be automatically generated.
parameters.name: application.id

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information to the application.
These tags are exposed in all the integration events of devices under
this application.

get.summary: List device-profiles used within the given application.
List device tags used within the given application.

delete.summary: Delete the application for the given ID.

get.summary: Get the application for the given ID.

publishName.description:
Publish name.
This is the name of the topic or queue.

Publish name.
This is the name of the topic or queue.

credentialsFile.description:
Credentials file.
This IAM service-account credentials file (JSON) must have the following
Pub/Sub roles:
* Pub/Sub Publisher

topicName.description:
Topic name.
This is the name of the Pub/Sub topic.

credentialsFile.description:
Credentials file.
This IAM service-account credentials file (JSON) must have the following
Pub/Sub roles:
* Pub/Sub Publisher

topicName.description:
Topic name.
This is the name of the Pub/Sub topic.

eventEndpointUrl.description:
Event endpoint URL.
The HTTP integration will POST all events to this enpoint. The request
will contain a query parameters "event" containing the type of the
event.

headers.description: HTTP headers to set when making requests.

eventEndpointUrl.description:
Event endpoint URL.
The HTTP integration will POST all events to this enpoint. The request
will contain a query parameters "event" containing the type of the
event.

headers.description: HTTP headers to set when making requests.

arbitraryJson.description:
Arbitrary JSON.
If set to true, ChirpStack events will be sent as-is as arbitrary JSON
payload. If set to false (default), the 3 JSON values format will be used.

eventPrefix.description:
Event prefix.
If set, the event name will be PREFIX_EVENT. For example if event_prefix
is set to weatherstation, and uplink event will be sent as
weatherstation_up to the IFTTT webhook.
Note: Only characters in the A-Z, a-z and 0-9 range are allowed.

key.description:
Key.
This key can be obtained from the IFTTT Webhooks documentation page.

uplinkValues.description:
Values.
Up to 2 values can be forwarded to IFTTT. These values must map to the
decoded payload keys. For example:
{
  "batteryLevel": 75.3,
  "buttons": [{"pressed": false}, {"pressed": true}]
}
You would specify the following fields:
uplink_values = ["batteryLevel", "buttons_0_pressed"]

arbitraryJson.description:
Arbitrary JSON.
If set to true, ChirpStack events will be sent as-is as arbitrary JSON
payload. If set to false (default), the 3 JSON values format will be used.

eventPrefix.description:
Event prefix.
If set, the event name will be PREFIX_EVENT. For example if event_prefix
is set to weatherstation, and uplink event will be sent as
weatherstation_up to the IFTTT webhook.
Note: Only characters in the A-Z, a-z and 0-9 range are allowed.

key.description:
Key.
This key can be obtained from the IFTTT Webhooks documentation page.

uplinkValues.description:
Values.
Up to 2 values can be forwarded to IFTTT. These values must map to the
decoded payload keys. For example:
{
  "batteryLevel": 75.3,
  "buttons": [{"pressed": false}, {"pressed": true}]
}
You would specify the following fields:
uplink_values = ["batteryLevel", "buttons_0_pressed"]

parameters.description:
Max number of device-profile templates to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

autoDetectMeasurements.description:
Auto-detect measurements.
If set to true, measurements will be automatically added based on the
keys of the decoded payload. In cases where the decoded payload contains
random keys in the data, you want to set this to false.

classBPingSlotPeriodicity.description:
Class-B ping-slot periodicity (only for Class-B).
Valid options are: 0 - 7.

Number of ping-slots per beacon-period:
pingNb = 2^(7-periodicity)

Periodicity: 0 = 128 ping-slots per beacon period = ~ every 1 sec
Periodicity: 7 = 1 ping-slot per beacon period = ~ every 128 sec

classBTimeout.description:
Class-B timeout (seconds).
This is the maximum time ChirpStack will wait to receive an acknowledgement from the device (if requested).

classCTimeout.description:
Class-C timeout (seconds).
This is the maximum time ChirpStack will wait to receive an acknowledgement from the device (if requested).

deviceStatusReqInterval.description:
Device-status request interval (times / day).
This defines the times per day that ChirpStack will request the device-status
from the device.

measurements.description:
Measurements.
If defined, ChirpStack will visualize these metrics in the web-interface.

uplinkInterval.description:
Uplink interval (seconds).
This defines the expected uplink interval which the device uses for
communication. When the uplink interval has expired and no uplink has
been received, the device is considered inactive.

delete.summary: Delete the device-profile template with the given ID.

get.summary: Get the device-profile template for the given ID.

parameters.description:
Max number of device-profiles to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If set, the given string will be used to search on name.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Tenant ID to list the device-profiles for.
parameters.name: tenantId

parameters.description:
Device-profile ID (UUID).
Note: on create this will be automatically generated.
parameters.name: deviceProfile.id

allowRoaming.description:
Allow roaming.

If set to true, it means that the device is allowed to use roaming.

autoDetectMeasurements.description:
Auto-detect measurements.
If set to true, measurements will be automatically added based on the
keys of the decoded payload. In cases where the decoded payload contains
random keys in the data, you want to set this to false.

classBPingSlotPeriodicity.description:
Class-B ping-slot periodicity.
Valid options are: 0 - 7.

Number of ping-slots per beacon-period:
pingNb = 2^(7-periodicity)

Periodicity: 0 = 128 ping-slots per beacon period = ~ every 1 sec
Periodicity: 7 = 1 ping-slot per beacon period = ~ every 128 sec

classBTimeout.description:
Class-B timeout (seconds).
This is the maximum time ChirpStack will wait to receive an acknowledgement
from the device (if requested).

classCTimeout.description:
Class-C timeout (seconds).
This is the maximum time ChirpStack will wait to receive an acknowledgement
from the device (if requested).

deviceStatusReqInterval.description:
Device-status request interval (times / day).
This defines the times per day that ChirpStack will request the
device-status from the device.

isRelay.description:
Device is a Relay device.
Enable this in case the device is a Relay. A Relay device implements TS011
and is able to relay data from relay capable devices.
See for more information the TS011 specification.

isRelayEd.description:
Device is a Relay end-device.
Enable this in case the device is an end-device that can operate under a
Relay. Please refer to the TS011 specification for more information.

measurements.description:
Measurements.
If defined, ChirpStack will visualize these metrics in the web-interface.

regionConfigId.description:
Region configuration ID.
If set, devices will only use the associated region. If let blank, then
devices will use all regions matching the selected common-name. Note
that multiple region configurations can exist for the same common-name,
e.g. to provide an 8 channel and 16 channel configuration for the US915
band.

relayDefaultChannelIndex.description:
Relay default channel index.
Valid values are 0 and 1, please refer to the RP002 specification for
the meaning of these values.

relayEdBackOff.description:
Relay end-device back-off (in case it does not receive WOR ACK frame).
0 = Always send a LoRaWAN uplink
1..63 = Send a LoRaWAN uplink after X WOR frames without a WOR ACK

relayEdRelayOnly.description:
End-device only accept data through relay.
Only accept data for this device through a relay. This setting is useful
for testing as in case of a test-setup, the end-device is usually within
range of the gateway.

relayEdUplinkLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay end-device uplink limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayEdUplinkLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay end-device uplink limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 62 = X tokens every hour
  * 63     = no limitation

relayGlobalUplinkLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay globak uplink limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayGlobalUplinkLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay global uplink limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

relayJoinReqLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay join-request limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayJoinReqLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay join-request limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

relayNotifyLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay notify limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayNotifyLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay notify limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

relayOverallLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay overall limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayOverallLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay overall limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

rx1Delay.description:
RX1 Delay.

This makes it possible to override the system RX1 Delay. Please note that
this values only has effect in case it is higher than the system value.
In other words, it can be used to increase the RX1 Delay but not to decrease
it.
Valid options are 1 - 15 (0 = always use system RX1 Delay).

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information the the
device-profile. These tags are exposed in all the integration events of
devices using this device-profile.

uplinkInterval.description:
Uplink interval (seconds).
This defines the expected uplink interval which the device uses for
communication. If the uplink interval has expired and no uplink has
been received, the device is considered inactive.

delete.summary: Delete the device-profile with the given ID.

get.summary: Get the device-profile for the given ID.

parameters.description:
Max number of devices to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If set, the given string will be used to search on name (optional).
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Application ID (UUID) to filter devices on.
parameters.name: applicationId

parameters.description: Multicst-group ID (UUID) to filter devices on.
parameters.name: multicastGroupId

parameters.description: If set, the given value will be used to sort by (optional).
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description: If set, the sorting direction will be decending (default = ascending) (optional).
parameters.name: orderByDesc

parameters.description: Device-profile ID (UUID) to filter devices on.
parameters.name: deviceProfileId

delete.summary: Delete the device with the given DevEUI.

get.summary: Get returns the device for the given DevEUI.

GetActivation returns the current activation details of the device (OTAA or
ABP).

delete.summary: FlushDevNonces flushes the OTAA device nonces.

post.summary:
GetNextFCntDown returns the next FCntDown to use for enqueing encrypted
downlinks. The difference with the DeviceActivation f_cont_down is that
this method takes potential existing queue-items into account.

GetRandomDevAddr returns a random DevAddr taking the NwkID prefix into
account.

delete.summary: Delete the device-keys for the given DevEUI.

get.summary: Get the device-keys for the given DevEUI.

parameters.description:
Aggregation.

 - HOUR: Hour.
 - DAY: Day.
 - MONTH: Month.
 - MINUTE: Minute.
parameters.name: aggregation

get.summary:
GetLinkMetrics returns the device link metrics.
This includes uplinks, downlinks, RSSI, SNR, etc...

parameters.description:
Aggregation.

 - HOUR: Hour.
 - DAY: Day.
 - MONTH: Month.
 - MINUTE: Minute.
parameters.name: aggregation

get.summary:
GetMetrics returns the device metrics.
Note that this requires a device-profile with codec and measurements
configured.

parameters.description: Return only the count, not the result-set.
parameters.name: countOnly

joinEui.description:
JoinEUI (optional, EUI64).
This field will be automatically set / updated on OTAA. However, in some
cases it must be pre-configured. For example to allow OTAA using a Relay.
In this case the Relay needs to know the JoinEUI + DevEUI combinations
of the devices for which it needs to forward uplinks.

skipFcntCheck.description:
Skip frame-counter checks (this is insecure, but could be helpful for
debugging).

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information to the device.
These tags are exposed in all the integration events.

variables.description:
Variables (user defined).
These variables can be used together with integrations to store tokens /
secrets that must be configured per device. These variables are not
exposed in the event payloads.

fNwkSIntKey.description:
Forwarding network session integrity key (HEX encoded).
Note: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x devices, set this to the NwkSKey.

nwkSEncKey.description:
Network session encryption key (HEX encoded).
Note: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x devices, set this to the NwkSKey.

sNwkSIntKey.description:
Serving network session integrity key (HEX encoded).
Note: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x devices, set this to the NwkSKey.

post.summary:
Activate (re)activates the device with the given parameters (for ABP or for
importing OTAA activations).

appKey.description:
Application root key (128 bit).
Note: This field only needs to be set for LoRaWAN 1.1.x devices!

genAppKey.description:
Gen App Key (128 bit).
Note: This field only needs to be set for LoRaWAN 1.0.x devices that
implement TS005 (remote multicast setup).

nwkKey.description:
Network root key (128 bit).
Note: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x, use this field for the LoRaWAN 1.0.x 'AppKey`!

appKey.description:
Application root key (128 bit).
Note: This field only needs to be set for LoRaWAN 1.1.x devices!

genAppKey.description:
Gen App Key (128 bit).
Note: This field only needs to be set for LoRaWAN 1.0.x devices that
implement TS005 (remote multicast setup).

nwkKey.description:
Network root key (128 bit).
Note: For LoRaWAN 1.0.x, use this field for the LoRaWAN 1.0.x 'AppKey`!

data.description:
Data.
Or use the json_object field when a codec has been configured.

expiresAt.description:
Expires at (optional).
Expired queue-items will be automatically removed from the queue.

fCntDown.description:
Downlink frame-counter.
Do not set this for plain-text data payloads. It will be automatically set
by ChirpStack when the payload has been sent as downlink.

id.description:
ID (UUID).
This is automatically generated on enqueue.

isEncrypted.description:
Is encrypted.
This must be set to true if the end-application has already encrypted
the data payload. In this case, the f_cnt_down field must be set to
the corresponding frame-counter which has been used during the encryption.

isPending.description:
Is pending.
This is set by ChirpStack to true when the downlink is pending (e.g. it
has been sent, but a confirmation is still pending).

object.description:
Only use this when a codec has been configured that can encode this
object to bytes.

post.summary: Enqueue adds the given item to the downlink queue.

parameters.description:
Max number of gateways to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If set, the given string will be used to search on name (optional).
parameters.name: search

parameters.description:
Tenant ID (UUID) to filter gateways on.
To list all gateways as a global admin user, this field can be left blank.
parameters.name: tenantId

parameters.description: Multicast-group ID (UUID) to filter gateways on.
parameters.name: multicastGroupId

parameters.description: If set, the given value will be used to sort by (optional).
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description: If set, the sorting direction will be decending (default = ascending) (optional).
parameters.name: orderByDesc

parameters.description:
Max number of relay-gateways to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
Tenant ID (UUID) to filter relay-gateways on.
To list all relay-gateways as a global admin user, this field can be left blank.
parameters.name: tenantId

statsInterval.description:
Stats interval (seconds).
This defines the expected interval in which the gateway sends its
statistics.

Stats interval (seconds).
This defines the expected interval in which the gateway sends its
statistics.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the gateway matching the given Gateway ID.

get.summary: Get returns the gateway for the given Gateway ID.

GetDutyCycleMetrics returns the duty-cycle metrics.
Note that only the last 2 hours of data are stored. Currently only per minute aggregation is available.

parameters.description:
Aggregation.

 - HOUR: Hour.
 - DAY: Day.
 - MONTH: Month.
 - MINUTE: Minute.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description:
Max number of multicast groups to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If set, the given string will be used to search on name.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Application ID to list the multicast groups for.
parameters.name: applicationId

delete.summary: Delete the multicast-group with the given ID.

get.summary: Get returns the multicast group for the given ID.

parameters.description:
ID (UUID).
This will be generated automatically on create.
parameters.name: multicastGroup.id

applicationId.description:
Application ID.
After creation, this can not be updated.

classBPingSlotPeriodicity.description:
Class-B ping-slot periodicity (only for Class-B).
Valid options are: 0 - 7.

Number of ping-slots per beacon-period:
pingNb = 2^(7-periodicity)

Periodicity: 0 = 128 ping-slots per beacon period = ~ every 1 sec
Periodicity: 7 = 1 ping-slot per beacon period = ~ every 128 sec

mcAppSKey.description: Multicast application session key (HEX encoded AES128 key).

mcNwkSKey.description: Multicast network session key (HEX encoded AES128 key).

post.summary: Add a device to the multicast group.

delete.summary: Remove a device from the multicast group.

post.summary: Add a gateway to the multicast group.

delete.summary: Remove a gateway from the multicast group.
Flush the queue for the given multicast group.

get.summary: List the items in the multicast group queue.

expiresAt.description:
Expires at (optional).
Expired queue-items will be automatically removed from the queue.

fCnt.description:
Downlink frame-counter.
This will be automatically set on enqueue.

post.summary: Add the given item to the multicast group queue.

parameters.description:
Max number of tenants to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If set, the given string will be used to search on name.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description:
If set, filters the result set to the tenants of the user.
Only global API keys are able to filter by this field.
parameters.name: userId

delete.summary: Delete the tenant with the given ID.

get.summary: Get the tenant for the given ID.

parameters.description:
Tenant ID (UUID).
Note: this value will be automatically generated on create.
parameters.name: tenant.id

canHaveGateways.description: Can the tenant create and "own" Gateways?

maxDeviceCount.description:
Max. device count for tenant.
When set to 0, the tenant can have unlimited devices.

maxGatewayCount.description:
Max. gateway count for tenant.
When set to 0, the tenant can have unlimited gateways.

privateGatewaysDown.description:
Private gateways (downlink).
If enabled, then other tenants will not be able to schedule downlink
messages through the gateways of this tenant. For example, in case you
do want to share uplinks with other tenants (private_gateways_up=false),
but you want to prevent other tenants from using gateway airtime.

privateGatewaysUp.description:
Private gateways (uplink).
If enabled, then uplink messages will not be shared with other tenants.

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information to the tenant. These
tags are NOT exposed in the integration events.

parameters.description:
Max number of tenants to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Get the list of tenant users.
Get the the tenant user for the given tenant and user IDs.

email.description: Email (only used on get and when adding a user to a tenant).

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of the tenant.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

post.summary:
Add an user to the tenant.
Note: the user must already exist.

email.description: Email (only used on get and when adding a user to a tenant).

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of the tenant.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

parameters.description:
Max number of tenants to return in the result-set.
If not set, it will be treated as 0, and the response will only return the total_count.
parameters.name: limit

delete.summary: Delete the user with the given ID.

get.summary: Get the user for the given ID.

parameters.description:
User ID (UUID).
Will be set automatically on create.
parameters.name: user.id

isActive.description: Set to false to disable the user.

isAdmin.description: Set to true to make the user a global administrator.

note.description: Optional note to store with the user.

post.summary: Update the password for the given user.

id.description:
Application ID (UUID).
Note: on create this will be automatically generated.

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information to the application.
These tags are exposed in all the integration events of devices under
this application.

publishName.description:
Publish name.
This is the name of the topic or queue.

apiCadPeriodicity.description:
- SEC_1: 1 second.
 - MS_500: 500 milliseconds
 - MS_250: 250 milliseconds
 - MS_100: 100 milliseconds
 - MS_50: 50 milliseconds
 - MS_20: 20 milliseconds

apiCodecRuntime.description:
- NONE: None.
 - CAYENNE_LPP: Cayenne LPP.
 - JS: JavaScript.

password.description: Password to set for the user.

tenants.description: Add the user to the following tenants.

joinEui.description:
JoinEUI (optional, EUI64).
This field will be automatically set / updated on OTAA. However, in some
cases it must be pre-configured. For example to allow OTAA using a Relay.
In this case the Relay needs to know the JoinEUI + DevEUI combinations
of the devices for which it needs to forward uplinks.

Skip frame-counter checks (this is insecure, but could be helpful for
debugging).

Tags (user defined).

Network root key (128 bit).

Enable this in case the device is an end-device that can operate under a
Relay. Please refer to the TS011 specification for more information.

measurements.description:
Measurements.
If defined, ChirpStack will visualize these metrics in the web-interface.

regionConfigId.description:
Region configuration ID.
If set, devices will only use the associated region. If let blank, then
devices will use all regions matching the selected common-name. Note
that multiple region configurations can exist for the same common-name,
e.g. to provide an 8 channel and 16 channel configuration for the US915
band.

relayDefaultChannelIndex.description:
Relay default channel index.
Valid values are 0 and 1, please refer to the RP002 specification for
the meaning of these values.

relayEdBackOff.description:
Relay end-device back-off (in case it does not receive WOR ACK frame).
0 = Always send a LoRaWAN uplink
1..63 = Send a LoRaWAN uplink after X WOR frames without a WOR ACK

relayEdRelayOnly.description:
End-device only accept data through relay.
Only accept data for this device through a relay. This setting is useful
for testing as in case of a test-setup, the end-device is usually within
range of the gateway.

relayEdUplinkLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay end-device uplink limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayEdUplinkLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay end-device uplink limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 62 = X tokens every hour
  * 63     = no limitation

relayGlobalUplinkLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay globak uplink limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayGlobalUplinkLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay global uplink limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

relayJoinReqLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay join-request limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayJoinReqLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay join-request limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

relayNotifyLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay notify limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayNotifyLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay notify limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

relayOverallLimitBucketSize.description:
Relay overall limit bucket size.

This field indicates the multiplier to determine the bucket size
according to the following formula:
BucketSize TOKEN = _reload_rate x _bucket_size

Valid values (0 - 3):
  0 = 1
  1 = 2
  2 = 4
  3 = 12

relayOverallLimitReloadRate.description:
Relay overall limit reload rate.

Valid values:
  * 0 - 126 = X tokens every hour
  * 127     = no limitation

rx1Delay.description:
RX1 Delay.

This makes it possible to override the system RX1 Delay. Please note that
this values only has effect in case it is higher than the system value.
In other words, it can be used to increase the RX1 Delay but not to decrease
it.
Valid options are 1 - 15 (0 = always use system RX1 Delay).

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information the the
device-profile. These tags are exposed in all the integration events of
devices using this device-profile.

uplinkInterval.description:
Uplink interval (seconds).
This defines the expected uplink interval which the device uses for
communication. If the uplink interval has expired and no uplink has
been received, the device is considered inactive.

autoDetectMeasurements.description:
Auto-detect measurements.
If set to true, measurements will be automatically added based on the
keys of the decoded payload. In cases where the decoded payload contains
random keys in the data, you want to set this to false.

classBPingSlotPeriodicity.description:
Class-B ping-slot periodicity (only for Class-B).
Valid options are: 0 - 7.

Number of ping-slots per beacon-period:
pingNb = 2^(7-periodicity)

Periodicity: 0 = 128 ping-slots per beacon period = ~ every 1 sec
Periodicity: 7 = 1 ping-slot per beacon period = ~ every 128 sec

classBTimeout.description:
Class-B timeout (seconds).
This is the maximum time ChirpStack will wait to receive an acknowledgement from the device (if requested).

classCTimeout.description:
Class-C timeout (seconds).
This is the maximum time ChirpStack will wait to receive an acknowledgement from the device (if requested).

deviceStatusReqInterval.description:
Device-status request interval (times / day).
This defines the times per day that ChirpStack will request the device-status
from the device.

measurements.description:
Measurements.
If defined, ChirpStack will visualize these metrics in the web-interface.

uplinkInterval.description:
Uplink interval (seconds).
This defines the expected uplink interval which the device uses for
communication. When the uplink interval has expired and no uplink has
been received, the device is considered inactive.

data.description:
Data.
Or use the json_object field when a codec has been configured.

expiresAt.description:
Expires at (optional).
Expired queue-items will be automatically removed from the queue.

fCntDown.description:
Downlink frame-counter.
Do not set this for plain-text data payloads. It will be automatically set
by ChirpStack when the payload has been sent as downlink.

id.description:
ID (UUID).
This is automatically generated on enqueue.

isEncrypted.description:
Is encrypted.
This must be set to true if the end-application has already encrypted
the data payload. In this case, the f_cnt_down field must be set to
the corresponding frame-counter which has been used during the encryption.

isPending.description:
Is pending.
This is set by ChirpStack to true when the downlink is pending (e.g. it
has been sent, but a confirmation is still pending).

object.description:
Only use this when a codec has been configured that can encode this
object to bytes.

batteryLevel.description:
Device battery level as a percentage.
-1 when the battery level is not available.

externalPowerSource.description: Device is connected to an external power source.

margin.description:
The device margin status
-32..32: The demodulation SNR ration in dB

statsInterval.description:
Stats interval (seconds).
This defines the expected interval in which the gateway sends its
statistics.

state.description:
Gateway state.
Please note that the state of the gateway is driven by the stats
packages that are sent by the gateway.

apiGatewayState.description:
- NEVER_SEEN: The gateway has never sent any stats.
 - ONLINE: Online.
 - OFFLINE: Offline.

credentialsFile.description:
Credentials file.
This IAM service-account credentials file (JSON) must have the following
Pub/Sub roles:
* Pub/Sub Publisher

topicName.description:
Topic name.
This is the name of the Pub/Sub topic.

expiresAt.description: Expires at defines the expiration date of the certificate.
Expires at defines the expiration date of the certificate.

measurementKeys.description:
Measurement keys.
This contains the measurement keys from all the device-profiles that
are used by the devices under this application.

joinServerContext.description:
Join-Server context.
A non-empty value indicatest that ChirpStack does not have access to
the AppSKey and that the encryption / decryption of the payloads is
the responsibility of the end-application.

eventEndpointUrl.description:
Event endpoint URL.
The HTTP integration will POST all events to this enpoint. The request
will contain a query parameters "event" containing the type of the
event.

headers.description: HTTP headers to set when making requests.

arbitraryJson.description:
Arbitrary JSON.
If set to true, ChirpStack events will be sent as-is as arbitrary JSON
payload. If set to false (default), the 3 JSON values format will be used.

eventPrefix.description:
Event prefix.
If set, the event name will be PREFIX_EVENT. For example if event_prefix
is set to weatherstation, and uplink event will be sent as
weatherstation_up to the IFTTT webhook.
Note: Only characters in the A-Z, a-z and 0-9 range are allowed.

key.description:
Key.
This key can be obtained from the IFTTT Webhooks documentation page.

uplinkValues.description:
Values.
Up to 2 values can be forwarded to IFTTT. These values must map to the
decoded payload keys. For example:
{
  "batteryLevel": 75.3,
  "buttons": [{"pressed": false}, {"pressed": true}]
}
You would specify the following fields:
uplink_values = ["batteryLevel", "buttons_0_pressed"]

totalCount.description: Total number of integrations available within the result-set.

forwardFPorts.description:
Forward FPorts.
Forward uplink messages matching the given FPorts to the MGS.

geolocationBufferTtl.description:
Geolocation buffer TTL (in seconds).
If > 0, uplink RX meta-data will be stored in a buffer so that
the meta-data of multiple uplinks can be used for geolocation.

geolocationGnssPayloadField.description:
GNSS payload field.
This holds the name of the field in the decoded payload object which
contains the GNSS payload bytes (as HEX string).

geolocationGnssUseRxTime.description:
GNSS use RX time.
In case this is set to true, the resolver will use the RX time of the
network instead of the timestamp included in the LR1110 payload.

geolocationMinBufferSize.description:
Geolocation minimum buffer size.
If > 0, geolocation will only be performed when the buffer has
at least the given size.

geolocationWifiPayloadField.description:
Wifi payload field.
This holds the name of the field in the decoded payload object which
contains an array of objects with the following fields:
* macAddress - e.g. 01:23:45:67:89:ab
* signalStrength - e.g. -51 (optional)

gnssUseGatewayLocation.description:
Use gateway location for GNSS resolving.
In the case this is set to true, ChirpStack will provide the location of
one of the gateways to the MGS resolver to aid the resolving process.
Disable this in case the gateway location is not accurate / incorrectly
configured as an incorrect location will cause the resolver to return an
error.

gnssUseRxTime.description:
Use rx time for GNSS resolving.
In case this is set to true, the MGS resolver will use the RX time of the
network instead of the timestamp included in the LR1110 payload.

parseTlv.description:
Parse TLV records.
If enabled, stream records (expected in TLV format) are scanned for GNSS
data (0x06 or 0x07). If found, ChirpStack will make an additional
geolocation call to the MGS API for resolving the location of the detected
payload.

apiMeasurementKind.description:
- UNKNOWN: Unknown (in which case it is not tracked).
 - COUNTER: Incrementing counters that never decrease (these are not reset on each
reading).
 - ABSOLUTE: Counters that do get reset upon reading.
 - GAUGE: E.g. a temperature value.
 - STRING: E.g. a firmware version, true / false value.

applicationId.description:
Application ID.
After creation, this can not be updated.

classBPingSlotPeriodicity.description:
Class-B ping-slot periodicity (only for Class-B).
Valid options are: 0 - 7.

Number of ping-slots per beacon-period:
pingNb = 2^(7-periodicity)

Periodicity: 0 = 128 ping-slots per beacon period = ~ every 1 sec
Periodicity: 7 = 1 ping-slot per beacon period = ~ every 128 sec

id.description:
ID (UUID).
This will be generated automatically on create.

mcAppSKey.description: Multicast application session key (HEX encoded AES128 key).

mcNwkSKey.description: Multicast network session key (HEX encoded AES128 key).

expiresAt.description:
Expires at (optional).
Expired queue-items will be automatically removed from the queue.

fCnt.description:
Downlink frame-counter.
This will be automatically set on enqueue.

apiMulticastGroupSchedulingType.description:
- DELAY: Delay.
If multicast downlinks must be sent through multiple gateways, then
these will be sent one by one with a delay between each gateway.
 - GPS_TIME: Time.
If multicast downlinks must be sent through multiple gateways, then
these will be sent simultaneously using GPS time synchronization.
Note that this does require GPS time-synchronized LoRa gateways.

statsInterval.description:
Stats interval (seconds).
This defines the expected interval in which the gateway sends its
statistics.

state.description:
Gateway state.
Please note that the state of the relay is driven by the last
received stats packet sent by the relay-gateway.

apiRelayModeActivation.description:
- DISABLE_RELAY_MODE: Disable the relay mode.
 - ENABLE_RELAY_MODE: Enable the relay model.
 - DYNAMIC: Dynamic.
 - END_DEVICE_CONTROLLED: End-device controlled.

canHaveGateways.description: Can the tenant create and "own" Gateways?

id.description:
Tenant ID (UUID).
Note: this value will be automatically generated on create.

maxDeviceCount.description:
Max. device count for tenant.
When set to 0, the tenant can have unlimited devices.

maxGatewayCount.description:
Max. gateway count for tenant.
When set to 0, the tenant can have unlimited gateways.

privateGatewaysDown.description:
Private gateways (downlink).
If enabled, then other tenants will not be able to schedule downlink
messages through the gateways of this tenant. For example, in case you
do want to share uplinks with other tenants (private_gateways_up=false),
but you want to prevent other tenants from using gateway airtime.

privateGatewaysUp.description:
Private gateways (uplink).
If enabled, then uplink messages will not be shared with other tenants.

tags.description:
Tags (user defined).
These tags can be used to add additional information to the tenant. These
tags are NOT exposed in the integration events.

canHaveGateways.description: Can the tenant create and "own" Gateways?

email.description: Email (only used on get and when adding a user to a tenant).

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of the tenant.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

isAdmin.description:
User is admin within the context of the tenant.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

apiTs003Version.description:
- TS003_NOT_IMPLEMENTED: Not implemented.
 - TS003_V100: v1.0.0.
 - TS003_v200: v2.0.0

apiTs004Version.description:
- TS004_NOT_IMPLEMENTED: Not implemented.
 - TS004_V100: v1.0.0.
 - TS004_V200: v2.0.0

apiTs005Version.description:
- TS005_NOT_IMPLEMENTED: Not implemented.
 - TS005_V100: v1.0.0.
 - TS005_V200: v2.0.0

id.description:
User ID (UUID).
Will be set automatically on create.

isActive.description: Set to false to disable the user.

isAdmin.description: Set to true to make the user a global administrator.

note.description: Optional note to store with the user.

isActive.description: Set to false to disable the user.

isAdmin.description: Set to true to make the user a global administrator.

User is admin within the context of the tenant.
There is no need to set the is_device_admin and is_gateway_admin flags.

isDeviceAdmin.description:
User is able to modify device related resources (applications,
device-profiles, devices, multicast-groups).

isGatewayAdmin.description: User is able to modify gateways.

commonAggregation.description:
- HOUR: Hour.
 - DAY: Day.
 - MONTH: Month.
 - MINUTE: Minute.

commonDeviceClass.description:
- CLASS_A: Class-A.
 - CLASS_B: Class-B.
 - CLASS_C: Class-C.

aesKey.description: AES key (when the kek_label is set, this value must first be decrypted).

commonLocationSource.description:
- UNKNOWN: Unknown.
 - GPS: GPS.
 - CONFIG: Manually configured.
 - GEO_RESOLVER_TDOA: Geo resolver (TDOA).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_RSSI: Geo resolver (RSSI).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_GNSS: Geo resolver (GNSS).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_WIFI: Geo resolver (WIFI).

data.description:
Data.
Each value index corresponds with the same timestamp index of the Metric.

commonMetricKind.description:
- COUNTER: Incrementing counters that never decrease (these are not reset on each
reading).
 - ABSOLUTE: Counters that do get reset upon reading.
 - GAUGE: E.g. a temperature value.

commonRegion.description:
- EU868: EU868
 - US915: US915
 - CN779: CN779
 - EU433: EU433
 - AU915: AU915
 - CN470: CN470
 - AS923: AS923
 - AS923_2: AS923 with -1.80 MHz frequency offset
 - AS923_3: AS923 with -6.60 MHz frequency offset
 - AS923_4: (AS923 with -5.90 MHz frequency offset).
 - KR920: KR920
 - IN865: IN865
 - RU864: RU864
 - ISM2400: ISM2400 (LoRaWAN 2.4 GHz)

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
